Il secondo rischioso ed esige attenzione e apprendimento continui: cercare e saper riconoscere chi e cosa, in mezzo allinferno, non inferno, e farlo durare, e dargli spazio. Italo Calvino

lender.name: William
lender.loan_because:
Volunteered in Khayelitsha in South Africa in 2008 on a week long building blitz with 2,000 Irish volunteers. We built a total of 253 (2-bedroom) houses in one week and re-housed 1,250 people.
Travelled to Ambo in Ethiopia for 2 weeks in 2010 on a Deaf development/ education project. We hope to assist local Deaf people in their efforts to establish a Centre for the Deaf.
The poverty in both places was shocking but the warmth of the people was amazing.
Sometimes people need very little to get out of poverty.
We all have dreams- everyone should have the ability to realise their dreams and succeed- it may take many attempts but its worth it.
I hope my loan is a stepping stone for people and hopefully some of their hopes may be realised.
lender.occupational_info: I work in Ireland with Deaf and hard of hearing people.

lender.name: Gerv
lender.loan_because:
Jesus commands me to help the poor and needy.
(Note: the Bible says in Matthew 6:3 that, when giving, you should not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing. In other words, don't tell everyone about it. But Kiva does not allow someone to lend anonymously and yet be themselves in the forums etc. and be part of the Kiva community. So I have two accounts - this one for interacting with other Kivans, and an anonymous one for doing my lending.)
lender.occupational_info: I help the Mozilla project to run smoothly.

lender.name: Rahul Sabbineni
lender.loan_because: I believe that many developing countries lack the intricate fiscally solvent networks of developed countries, and that through microfinance, one can make a difference in expanding financial access to a group of people largely ignored by credit.

lender.name: Rune
lender.loan_because: We have to help each other.
lender.occupational_info: I design buildings.

lender.name: Tom
lender.loan_because: My first loan was a gift from a friend to help memorialize my mom. Beyond that, I am committed to cultural exchange. Cultural exchange is important if we are to sustain lasting social initiatives throughout the world. You get to know me; I get to know you. After that, progress is possible. One way to go about this is the Kiva way: one loan at a time.
lender.occupational_info: I work with adults and children with intellectual disabilities. In the work I do, we change the world one person at a time......

lender.name: Lauren
lender.loan_because: Kiva makes it easy to help.

lender.name: Lynn
lender.loan_because: A friend provided me a KIVA donation in my name as a gift, which was much appreciated. KIVA is a wonderful system. Empowering independent farming is essential on both a local and global level.
lender.occupational_info: I have a passion for sustainable living, conserving our natural resources, and wild animal protection. I am fortunate to live in an area with an abundance and variety of locally grown foods. I admire the hard work and pride that goes into maintaining a small family farm.

lender.name: The Noble Pagan
lender.loan_because:
We are a world wide community of pagans and other nature based religions that believe that to better help the world, we must first reach out to the individuals that inhabit the world. What better way to do that than through Kiva?
When we first found Kiva we were very impressed at the professionalism and the human outreach that is behind the program and we fully endorse what Kiva stands for.
We loan because we believe that the easiest way to help someone is to give them the means to help themselves. Kiva provides a way to do this.
lender.occupational_info: We provide the world wide community of pagans and other nature-based religions of the world a way to bring together the knowledge and experiences of the entire community. Our mission statement is, "Pagans helping pagans by promoting tolerance through education." We can effectively raise tolerance of all peoples, not just religions, simply by raising the awareness and knowledge of those that may not fully understand. We do this through our online community, our various outreach programs and by being available for research and writings by prominent figures within the world wide pagan community.

lender.name: okappan
lender.loan_because: fun
lender.occupational_info: Business Development and photographer for a Japan based IT news site "TechWave".

lender.name: Mark
lender.loan_because: I think it is brilliant to help people directly, and because I can.
lender.occupational_info: I work in a shop which sells art supplies

lender.name: Shawn
lender.loan_because: I want to help others.

lender.name: Mel
lender.loan_because: I enjoy helping other women succeed.

lender.name: Brin Family
lender.loan_because: We participate in lending, because it is the right thing to do! We are teaching our children to help others in need. We hope that when they have their own families that they in turn will pass it on.

lender.name: Petria
lender.loan_because: its nice to give a little

lender.name: Wing
lender.loan_because:
"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give."
If you can't feed a hundred people, then just feed one.
It's important to give it all you have while you have the chance.
lender.occupational_info: Everyday is an adventure.

lender.name: Paul
lender.loan_because: I believe that everyone should reach out to those less fortunate than myself in an effort to improve their lives.
lender.occupational_info: I teach geography to US college students. I am very concerned about poverty in the world and I try to convey the extent of poverty in the world to my students many of whom have not traveled outside of North Carolina USA.

lender.name: Stephen
lender.loan_because: The "world is flat" now. I see Kiva loans as a way to help make it even flatter.
lender.occupational_info: I design and build prototypes for new kinds of network services. I hope that they empower others to connect in new ways.

lender.name: Mike
lender.loan_because: it's something I like to do.
lender.occupational_info: I operate an art gallery and picture framing shop employing five people on Vancouver Island in Canada.

lender.name: Whitley
lender.loan_because: I hope to start my own business one day so I respect these people who have struggled much more than I have starting their own businesses.
lender.occupational_info: I am a student at one of the top schools in the country.

lender.name: Daniel
lender.whereabouts: Sydney, Watson Bay New South Wales
lender.loan_because: I want to make a tangible difference to less fortunate than myself.
lender.occupational_info: Officer in the Australian Navy

lender.name: Sara
lender.loan_because: I want to help those who are less fortunate than me and who are willing to take charge and make their lives better

lender.name: Marco
lender.loan_because: I learned from my grandfather that the real joy of life was giving and sharing what we have with people that will appreciate! People shouldn't have wealth equally distributed that's unfair for hard-working people, but people must have access to the same opportunities.
lender.occupational_info: Computers and more computers! I'm in charge of the R&D for a high-tech global outsourcing company. We're located in Costa Rica.

lender.name: Brown Paper TIckets
lender.loan_because: Direct interaction and communication creates community.
lender.occupational_info: We sell tickets to live events, like shows, dances, film, music, and really, just about anything! It's great fun.

lender.name: Nils
lender.loan_because: I believe in individual responsibility, selfconfidence and courage in order to act against injustice to the benefit of creationing and maintaining human rights.
